div.p: We’re heading into another presidential election year, which means the news is packed with debate coverage, campaign stumping, candidate soundbites and pollsters taking America’s pulse. But what do...

li.a: Cool to be Kind kicks off at Elementary
Red Ribbon Week brings drug awareness to Morton ISD

div.p: I need to make a clarification on this week's Campfire Chat. When I said that you could do all of one class's work in one day, that was not to imply that there would only be one assignment. Teachers are putting the entire week's assignments out at once rather than daily.
A New High School Campfire Chat for April 23th is up on the webpage, Go to www.mortonisd.net to watch the video.
New Campfire Chat for April 20th is up on the webpage, www.mortonisd.net Click on the Campfire icon

Parents! Yearbook is seeking photos of our students working, playing and enjoying family time during the stay at home period. We need these ASAP as we have to get the yearbook completed. Please email russell.hill@mortonisd.net Thank you for making yearbook a success!

Las escuelas permanecerán cerradas con "Learn at Home" continuando hasta el final del año. Se publicará más información en nuestro sitio web en www.mortonisd.net Haga clic en el icono rojo "Aprender en casa".
Schools will remain closed with "Learn at Home" continuing till the end of the school year.
K-2 Parents, Go to the Morton ISD website and click on Learn at Home link or click on the link below to watch videos on how to help your student with their iPads
Working hard to make sure our kids are safe!
